title: Missing HTTP Security Headers - Misconfiguration
description: The application does not implement essential HTTP security headers to protect against common web vulnerabilities. The response is missing: X-Frame-Options (clickjacking protection), X-Content-Type-Options (MIME sniffing protection), X-XSS-Protection (XSS protection), Content-Security-Policy (XSS, injection prevention), and Strict-Transport-Security/HSTS (SSL/TLS enforcement). This is a misconfiguration of the Apache 2.4.25 web server that leaves the application vulnerable to various client-side attacks.
impact: Missing security headers increase vulnerability to: 1) Clickjacking attacks - without X-Frame-Options, the page can be framed in malicious contexts, 2) MIME sniffing attacks - without X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff, browsers may interpret content incorrectly, 3) XSS attacks - lack of X-XSS-Protection and CSP reduces defense depth, 4) Man-in-the-middle attacks - without HSTS, users may downgrade to HTTP. These vulnerabilities could be chained with other attacks to compromise user sessions or steal credentials.
evidence:
POC execution confirms all 5 critical security headers are missing from HTTP responses:

Headers Present in Response:
- Date: Fri, 07 Nov 2025 16:45:41 GMT
- Server: Apache/2.4.25 (Debian)
- X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40
- Vary: Accept-Encoding
- Content-Length: 3609
- Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

Critical Headers MISSING (0 out of 5 present):
- X-Frame-Options: NOT PRESENT (vulnerable to clickjacking)
- X-Content-Type-Options: NOT PRESENT (vulnerable to MIME sniffing)
- X-XSS-Protection: NOT PRESENT (reduced XSS protection)
- Content-Security-Policy: NOT PRESENT (missing injection/XSS prevention)
- Strict-Transport-Security: NOT PRESENT (no HTTPS enforcement)

POC Output:
Security Headers Found: 0
Security Headers Missing: 5
VULNERABILITY CONFIRMED: 5 critical security headers are missing
remediation:
1. Enable Apache mod_headers module: a2enmod headers
2. Add security headers to Apache configuration (/etc/apache2/apache2.conf or site-specific config):
   - Header set X-Frame-Options "DENY"
   - Header set X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
   - Header set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
   - Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'"
   - Header set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains"
3. Alternative: Add headers to .htaccess file in application root
4. Test configuration with: curl -i http://localhost/ | grep -E "X-Frame|X-Content|X-XSS|Content-Security|Strict-Transport"
5. Restart Apache: systemctl restart apache2
6. Verify headers are present in all HTTP responses
references: OWASP A05:2021 - Security Misconfiguration, CWE-693 Protection Mechanism Failure, CWE-16 Configuration, OWASP Missing Security Header Cheat Sheet
toolCallDescription: Document missing HTTP security headers vulnerability with POC evidence
